rSETSe 0.3
  • Reference

Create stabilosed blocks

Create_stabilised_blocks_expanded.Rd

decomposes the network into bi-connected components using articulation points. This speeds up the convergence process and reduces the chances of the SETS algorithm diverging

Create_stabilised_blocks_expanded(
  g,
  OriginBlock,
  OriginBlock_number,
  force = "force",
  edge_name = "edge_name",
  tstep = 0.1,
  coef_drag = coef_drag,
  tol = 0,
  distance,
  max_iter,
  mass,
  verbose = FALSE,
  sparse
)

Arguments

g

An igraph object
OriginBlock

An Igraph object. This is created by Create_balanced_blocks function
OriginBlock_number

An integer. this is the origin block chosen from the create_stable_blocks function. Usually this will be the largest block.
force

A character string. This is the node attribute that contains the force the nodes exert on the network.
edge_name

A character string. This is the edge attribute that contains the edge_name of the edges.
tstep

A numeric. The time interval used to iterate through the network dynamics.
coef_drag

A numeric. This sets the multiplier of friction. Only use if you want to be annoyed and confused
tol

A numeric. The tolerance factor for early stopping.
distance

A character string. The edge attribute that contains the original/horizontal distance between nodes.
max_iter

An integer. The maximum number of iterations before stopping. Larger networks usually need more iterations.
mass

A numeric. This is the mass constant of the nodes in normalised networks this is set to 1.
verbose

Logical. This value sets whether messages generated during the process are supressed or not.
sparse

Logical. Whether or not the function should be run using sparse matrices. must match the actual matrix, this could prob be automated

Value

A dataframe with the height embeddings of the network

See also

Create_stabilised_blocks
